tracks.title: The Tide Remembers
tracks.description: A meditation on memory and water. Recorded during three consecutive nights at the harbor, the layers of synthetic strings were sculpted around field recordings of waves meeting concrete.

tracks.title: Copper Frequency
tracks.description: Built from a single 9-minute improvisation. Yuki's ink paintings were completed while listening on loop — both works finished the same morning, neither seen by the other until the opening.

tracks.title: Glass Archive
tracks.description: A drone composition created for Lena's installation at the Speicher gallery. The piece evolves over 22 minutes with glacial shifts designed to reward those who stay still long enough to hear them.

tracks.title: Returning Home
tracks.description: Olusegun's collage work arrived first — three months of materials from Lagos, Accra, and London. The music came after, trying to hold all three cities at once without choosing between them.
